342 - 20 Dec 2023 08:35PM - Austin: Mining is a field of engineering that is concerned with the extraction and processing of minerals from the earth. It is a field that has been around for centuries and is currently experiencing a resurgence due to the increased demand for materials such as metals, minerals, and oil. However, due to the changing nature of the world‚Äôs economy, it is unclear whether mining will remain a viable field of study and profession 10 years down the line.  One of the primary reasons why mining may not be successful 10 years down the line is the increasing shift towards renewable energy sources. With the world‚Äôs reliance on fossil fuels decreasing, there is less need for the materials that mining engineers specialize in extracting and processing. Furthermore, the increasing focus on environmental conservation has also contributed to this shift, as the extraction of minerals and materials can often have a negative impact on the environment.  Finally, the increasing cost of labor may also be a factor in the decreased relevance of mining engineering 10 years down the line. As the cost of labor increases, it becomes more difficult for mining companies to remain profitable. This can lead to mining companies cutting back on labor costs, which can reduce the demand for mining and other professionals in the field.  In conclusion, mining may not be successful 10 years down the line due to the increasing shift towards renewable energy sources, the advancement of technology in other engineering fields, and the increasing cost of labor. As a result, mining may need to look for other opportunities in order to remain relevant and successful in the future.

121 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Let me brief you about the cost of higher education in India with respect to other countries and how Edoofa makes it affordable for students.
122 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: The cost of tertiary education in India is much lower than in Western countries. In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around *6000-8000 USD*. In contrast, tuition fees for higher education in the UK, for example, can range from *USD 15000 to USD 35000*. Meanwhile, the US tuition cost is much higher, with the average cost of a 4-year degree ranging from *USD 80,000 to over USD 250,000.*
123 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Now we wanted to make this cost of education even more affordable for the parents and students, *this is why our Parent Organisation Anhad Edutrain Solutions has worked with 250+ Universities for the last 14 years by helping them have the Employability Aspect in their education because of which from last 6 years Universities have been helping us to provide scholarship seats to the students so that their cost of education is reduced greatly.*
124 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
125 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Therefore, for the selected students who are able to qualify for the EDOOFA Program by undergoing various tests, the cost comes down to $2000-$3000 per year. This cost includes:  *1. Remaining Tuition fees (if any)* *2. Basic University Expenses (Library, etc.)* *3. Food* *4. Accommodation*  *after this we give the opportunity to the students to reduce their remaining annual fee as much as they can through our Earn While You Learn Program.*
172 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
173 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
174 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
175 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: My experience says *consistency* is key to success in Edoofa's Earn While You Learn Program. By attending sessions regularly and seeking guidance from mentors, students can not just build their skill set but earn a higher amount of scholarship credits as well. *Our star performers, or Proud Edoodians, have earned up to $3000* in just one year by constantly asking for more projects and assignments to improve their performance. With Edoofa's financial aid, students can self-sponsor their higher education.  I hope you can now realize how we are different isn‚Äôt it something that you have been looking for regarding your international education?

181 - 20 Dec 2023 04:21PM - Gurvinder: Alright now as we have covered majorly everything from the counseling session, so let me help you understand how Edoofa makes the Application fee affordable for the students as well. However, for that you would have to be proactive for the next 20 minutes.  Are you ready?
190 - 20 Dec 2023 04:37PM - Gurvinder: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!
191 - 20 Dec 2023 04:37PM - Gurvinder: Birthwell basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*
192 - 20 Dec 2023 04:38PM - Gurvinder: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

31 - 20 Dec 2023 09:36AM - Gurvinder: Noted, let me brief you about the program myself.
32 - 20 Dec 2023 09:36AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
33 - 20 Dec 2023 09:37AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
34 - 20 Dec 2023 09:37AM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. 261 - 20 Dec 2023 06:32PM - +263 78 313 4116: Name as per School Record- Gender-Famel Date of Birth as per School Record-10 August 2004 Father's Name-Kwanele Jonathan Dube Mother's Name-Sithembile Rosemary Senda Email Address- nodumophildube@gmail.com Parent's email address- sendarosemary@gmail.com/ Course: BA in sociology Intake Year: 2024 Country : India   1.A 2.D 3.C 4.B 5.B 6.A 7.B 8.√Ä 9.A 10.B 11.D 12.D 13.C 14.C 15.A 16.B   *Life in Rwanda 16 years after  the  genocide there*  Life in Rwanda after the genocide was not as lovely as it was as they had people who were suffering from depression and countless survivors developed long term psychological problem ,a number of children became orphaned,a number of women were raped and abused and had to heal from all these things not forgetting the economy of Rwanda was not stable after the genocide.....Rwanda suffered dearly in order to get back to the state they were once at  With the above stated on going problems in Rwanda is it easy for one to say Rwanda had a bad experience during the genocide.The issue of raped women and children is one serious matters as some of them may have been left with STI's and some of them suffered even facing other people in the community.  The economy of a country is one major thing a country realises on and with a dead economy in Rwanda it is easy for one to say that these people may have had serious cases of people starving to death.  Not only the economy was damaged but the facilities in Rwanda these people had to rebuild their country all over again and with a dead economy it was hard for them to have to get raw material imported into their country  In conclusion one may say Rwanda had it really bad and it took a lot for them to be where they're today.  *My inspiration story*  Well when it comes to being inspired I take it from the people I live with both at home and in my community..... Growing up in a country like Zimbabwe is not an easy thing honestly but everyday when we wake up and try building a name for ourselves we are told to go out there and show them who we are and what we are made of those words alone can make a child want to do more and be better than they were yesterday......yes we have people like Ellon Masks and Bill Gates who have inspired almost half of the world into working hard but I personally got my inspiration from my people,my grandma alway says "learn and be someone in life and take good care of us when you are older"hearing those words from an old lady who has ran her race for a long tym now helps remind me that I can be better and I can become better than I was a few days ago or even a few seconds ago..

The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on one‚Äôs preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  *BBA* degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills   *Bachelor of Business Administration* course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. 26 - 20 Dec 2023 11:33AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
27 - 20 Dec 2023 11:33AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*

78 - 20 Dec 2023 05:00PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

In the narration he mentioned he started like me living a low life in a neglected-like village with his grandparents. He had to walk a very long distance to school and sometimes get fired from school because he had not paid school fees. To counter that problem he had to do some piece jobs while going to school . From his explanation you could tell on your own that life was not a smooth flow for that person but he still made it in life .  That gave me courage and strength that I would make it. To be honest hope was not anywhere to be found that time because my parents were not yet employed and the jobs were not easy get. Getting a job was difficult ,morelike cutting an ignite rock with a nail cutter.  So I had to strive my primary school reading and studying very hard going to school not to waste any time , trying to utilize every dollar my parents had paid school fees because I knew they had not earn that money easily .  It was then when I was about to enter secondary school ( high school) my parents got lucky or I should say by God's mercy they got employed in the Ministry of education . They managed to keep sending me to school but it was hard and it is still hard for I am not the only kid in my family who need to go to school . My siblings also need that privilege so that made me consider looking for assistance in form scholarships and well-wishers like I am doing now. This will help me achieve my dream and reduce the burden of school fees from my parents. Not forgetting the motive from the well wisher , I want to be successful in life so that my kids and my circle of influence will not suffer the same problems I suffered that time .  That made me who I am now . Aiming to achieve something in life . Who knows maybe one day , I will be one person's motive as well. <This message was edited>

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase ‚Äògather resolution from danger‚Äô. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. 62 - 20 Dec 2023 12:15PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

376 - 20 Dec 2023 12:23PM - Harmehak: All the applicants who would be traveling to India for 2025 year's academic intake, Their application would utilize this time duration in the following ways:  1. The student would be working on their Earn While You Learn Program:- Having a head start that too of more than 20 months helps a student have a better hold in their EWYL Journey. During these years, one thing which I have personally witnessed is that a student who have better understanding of their EWYL projects and the ones who earn higher amount of scholarship credits every month, are the ones who always had this headstart in their career.  Giving you an example, Persistance Muza the student who earned over $4000 worth or scholarship credits, became a part of the Edoofa Program for his August 2022 intake in August 2021. The student earned more than $1900 worth of scholarship credits before even coming to India and within just a couple of months after arriving he has now earned an additional $2100 worth of scholarship credits, which has ensured his parents that he can cater for his annual fee after the scholarship through his hard work in the Earn While You Learn Program itself.  This happened only because students like him had time to understand the projects and assignments while being in their home country.  2. Parents would be communicating with the Admission's Team:- Having ample amount of time in hand, not just benefits the student but actually helps the parent as well to plan better for their child's international education journey. Therefore to utilize this for your advantage, you would be interacting with the admissions team and start preparing for your child's international journey for 2025. This means that if you are supposed to start saving for your child's annual fee after scholarship, this becomes the right time since admission officers would brief you on a regular basis regarding how you should plan for the finances, if you face any challenges you could get the same addressed since you have time before your child finally travels.  3,  Having the benefit of the Community:- This part doesn't just benefits the student but actually benefits the entire family. The moment student becomes a part of the Edoofa Program he/she starts interacting with other students who are a part of the community, this helps the student to connect with toppers of their fields, students who have scored a perfect result in their A Level during their academic year, this way a student gets the access to get all his/her queries addressed in terms of academics for their current year of education from the topper students, thereby reducing the need of private tuitions for the same, for which the parents would have paid additional money over and above their school fee.

54 - 20 Dec 2023 05:52PM - Harmehak: Actually you are mistaken over here, let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.

55 - 20 Dec 2023 04:08PM - Harmehak: *Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA* is a 3-year professional undergraduate course in Business Management. BBA course equips you with the right knowledge and skills in business and management and impart knowledge of the principles which are perfect for a career in the corporate world. A degree in Business Administration solidifies your base for your future Business and management career goals. Successful graduates of this course can opt for a range of jobs from sectors like human resource, finance, marketing, sales, management, government, and education.  Financial Analyst, Real Estate Management, Operation Management, Business Development Executive, Project Manager (IT), Data Analyst, Human Resources (HR) Manager Supply Chain Manager, Production Manager, Marketing Executive etc. are some such profiles which successful graduates interested in pursuing a job can opt for.  *What is BBA about?*  Bachelor of Business Administration is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this fer class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on one‚Äôs preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  BBA degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills Bachelor of Business Administration course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students.The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.  The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  BBA course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few.  Some of the major job profiles associated with BBA degree are as follows:  *Financial Analyst* *Production Manager* *Operations Team Leader* *Business Development Executive* *Real Estate Management* *Project Manager (IT)* *Data Analyst* *Human Resources (HR) Manager* *Marketing Executive*

49 - 20 Dec 2023 11:05AM - Kunal: *Bachelor of Pharmacy(B.Pharm.)* is a 4 year undergraduate program which is compulsory for anyone who wants to practice as a pharmacist. B. Pharmacy is study of preparing and conferring drugs and medicines for a number of illnesses and deficiencies.  Pharmacists are needed in every location and every hospital, due to which the scope of this course has increased positively. The program has been bringing out healthcare professionals from a long time and would continue to do so for years to come as the field is growing at a fast pace.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: What is it about?*  Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma) covers all the facets of healthcare including bio-chemical areas that concern the preparation of medicines and implementing those for the right diagnose. Prevailing modernization in the field of Pharmacy has globally increased its value. Bachelor of Pharmacy engages studies of all those subjects that therapeutically help people provided from their medicines.  The course is versatile and dynamic as it offers jobs in various fields like R & D, Manufacturing, Quality Control, packaging and much more.   B. Pharmacy is all about maintaining a standardized quality of people‚Äôs health and living. As a student of B. Pharmacy, you learn about the medicines and their effect on the human body, with details of the chemical and organic properties of all the elements used.  The program teaches students how to become attentive professionals so as to ensure selection of a right drug for the right treatment for which all topics of pharmacology, chemistry, pharmaceutical chemistry, biochemistry, kinetics, pharmacy management, and compounding medications are covered.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: Who should opt?*  Students who are willing to work around medicines and have a good attitude towards the pharma industry can opt for this course. This course is also ideal for people who wish to open or own a chemist shop and have strong business skills can also opt for B. Pharmacy. With a degree of Bachelor of Pharmacy, a student can register with the State Pharmacy Council and open their own Chemist shop to stock and sell medicines.  The course offers job opportunities in both public as well private sectors that allows students to make a valuable career in this field.Students can even opt for teaching job in this field, if they are willing to become a lecturer. There are different practice environments in this field, some of which are:  *Hospital Pharmacy* *Clinical Pharmacy* *Technical Pharmacy* *Research Agencies* *Medical Dispensing Store* *Food and Drug Administration* *Sales and Marketing Department* *Educational Institutes* *Health Centres*

184 - 20 Dec 2023 10:26AM - Kunal: *Physiotherapy* is a branch of healthcare that applies modes of physical movement such as exercise, massage, besides education, advice, and counselling services to circumstances where movement and function are threatened by ageing, pain, injury, diseases, disorders, conditions, or other environmental factors.  Students enrolled to the course are taught on an advanced level about core physiotherapeutic skills such as manual therapy, therapeutic exercises, and application of electro-physical modalities, which have been proven to cure a range of disabilities and disease related to spine, back, neck, and even stress-related incontinence.  Bachelor of Physiotherapy is a 4-year undergraduate course, including compulsory 6 months of clinical internship, and involving the science of physical movement aimed at preventing disease and disability.  The opportunities for a career in Physiotherapy are excellent, whether in the public health system, private practice or non-government organisations. Career pathways include the disciplines and areas of:  *Healthcare Management* *Industrial Rehabilitation* *Research & Academics* *Special Schools* *Multinational companies for fitness of their employers*

In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around *$6000-$8000 per year*. With the Edoofa Scholarship Program, the cost trips down to *$2000-$3000* for the students who are found Eligible for the program by qualifying the Eligibility check Process. 46 - 20 Dec 2023 12:28PM - Pallika Edoofa: A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*

59 - 20 Dec 2023 04:59PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: B. Pharm *Bachelor of Pharmacy(B.Pharm.)* is a 4 year undergraduate program which is compulsory for anyone who wants to practice as a pharmacist. B. Pharmacy is study of preparing and conferring drugs and medicines for a number of illnesses and deficiencies.  Pharmacists are needed in every location and every hospital, due to which the scope of this course has increased positively. The program has been bringing out healthcare professionals from a long time and would continue to do so for years to come as the field is growing at a fast pace.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: What is it about?*  Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma) covers all the facets of healthcare including bio-chemical areas that concern the preparation of medicines and implementing those for the right diagnose. Prevailing modernization in the field of Pharmacy has globally increased its value. Bachelor of Pharmacy engages studies of all those subjects that therapeutically help people provided from their medicines.  The course is versatile and dynamic as it offers jobs in various fields like R & D, Manufacturing, Quality Control, packaging and much more.   B. Pharmacy is all about maintaining a standardized quality of people‚Äôs health and living. As a student of B. Pharmacy, you learn about the medicines and their effect on the human body, with details of the chemical and organic properties of all the elements used.  The program teaches students how to become attentive professionals so as to ensure selection of a right drug for the right treatment for which all topics of pharmacology, chemistry, pharmaceutical chemistry, biochemistry, kinetics, pharmacy management, and compounding medications are covered.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: Who should opt?*  Students who are willing to work around medicines and have a good attitude towards the pharma industry can opt for this course. This course is also ideal for people who wish to open or own a chemist shop and have strong business skills can also opt for B. Pharmacy. With a degree of Bachelor of Pharmacy, a student can register with the State Pharmacy Council and open their own Chemist shop to stock and sell medicines.  The course offers job opportunities in both public as well private sectors that allows students to make a valuable career in this field.Students can even opt for teaching job in this field, if they are willing to become a lecturer. There are different practice environments in this field, some of which are:  *Hospital Pharmacy* *Clinical Pharmacy* *Technical Pharmacy* *Research Agencies* *Medical Dispensing Store* *Food and Drug Administration* *Sales and Marketing Department* *Educational Institutes* *Health Centres*

353 - 20 Dec 2023 10:53AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

198 - 20 Dec 2023 12:18PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final A results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
199 - 20 Dec 2023 12:18PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

247 - 20 Dec 2023 02:19PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final A results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
248 - 20 Dec 2023 02:19PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

The knowledge gained from a geography degree, especially in physical geography, can provide a strong foundation for understanding geological concepts.
395 - 20 Dec 2023 12:57PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: On the other hand, a Geographical Information Surveyor (GIS) specializes in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting spatial data using geographic information systems. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. 431 - 20 Dec 2023 01:16PM - Shubham Madhwal: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.
432 - 20 Dec 2023 01:16PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.
433 - 20 Dec 2023 01:16PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Financial Stability:* By planning early, parents can avoid financial stress and debt. Without proper planning, they may have to rely on loans or other high-cost financing options, which can lead to long-term financial challenges. SAVE YOURSELF FROM LOANS  *INTERNSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK:* Early planning can also involve students participating in projects that will be offered by the EWYL Department of Edoofa after Induction which can help offset the cost of education. These opportunities often have application deadlines, so planning allows parents to take advantage of them.  *Teach Financial Responsibility:* Involving children in the financial planning process can teach them valuable lessons about money management, savings, and responsibility. It helps instill good financial habits from an early age.
434 - 20 Dec 2023 01:16PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Avoiding Last-Minute Rush:* Delaying financial planning until the last minute can lead to rushed decisions and inadequate savings. Early planning provides a more thoughtful and organized approach.  *Goal Setting:* Setting specific financial goals for education allows parents to track their progress and adjust their savings strategies as needed. It provides a clear roadmap for achieving the desired educational outcomes.

311 - 20 Dec 2023 10:27AM - +263 77 262 6569: Sec 6  Some sixteen years ago,on the 1st day of June  2007,at around down my parents were blessed with a bouncing baby girl and they named her Blessed.That child is non other than the aurther of this writting. Growing in the Midlands Province of Zimbabwe were my parents were working as civil servants.Attended Primary education there in Midlance Province.Attained good results at Primary  level.My parents got a place for me again at a boarding school in Midlance province where I did form 1 and 2.Also  I passed with good results and as a reward to such performance, my parents transferred me to a better school in Harare for my form 3 and form 4. At a new school again I performed very well and was one of best students at school me. I set for my final examinations at the end of year and Iam waiting for my results.  Apart from schooling,I grow up in urban areas , interacting with friends in urban schools.I was made to grow in Christian Life where we respect every person since we believe that a human being was fearfully and wonderfully made by the Most High God in heaven.This taught me not to bully other children at school and anywhere else.Also I learnt that we need to do charity works so that we help those in need.We do not have just to receive good things from others but us also have to do also. Being a first born in a family of 4 kids and only girl, l learn to be responsible at tender age since I had to help my mother to take care of my siblings since Mom could not do it alone.I can now do my chores without anneccesaryly asking for help. Afternoon writing my final examinations ,whilst waiting for my results ,to avoid being  a school dropout,Iam doing driving lessons such that I upgrade my status as a lady.I have to equip myself to face the challenges of life. Now I pray that if I be given a scholarship since my parents are striving to pay fees for my sibling,I will utilise that chance to attain good results so that I will help my parents to take care of my siblings as well as other vulnerable kids in my society.It is my humble prayer that I be considered.

294 - 20 Dec 2023 12:59PM - Shubham Madhwal: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.
295 - 20 Dec 2023 12:59PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.

42 - 20 Dec 2023 02:43PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Pharmacy(B.Pharm.)* is a 4 year undergraduate program which is compulsory for anyone who wants to practice as a pharmacist. B. Pharmacy is study of preparing and conferring drugs and medicines for a number of illnesses and deficiencies.  Pharmacists are needed in every location and every hospital, due to which the scope of this course has increased positively. The program has been bringing out healthcare professionals from a long time and would continue to do so for years to come as the field is growing at a fast pace.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: What is it about?*  Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma) covers all the facets of healthcare including bio-chemical areas that concern the preparation of medicines and implementing those for the right diagnose. Prevailing modernization in the field of Pharmacy has globally increased its value. Bachelor of Pharmacy engages studies of all those subjects that therapeutically help people provided from their medicines.  The course is versatile and dynamic as it offers jobs in various fields like R & D, Manufacturing, Quality Control, packaging and much more.   B. Pharmacy is all about maintaining a standardized quality of people‚Äôs health and living. As a student of B. Pharmacy, you learn about the medicines and their effect on the human body, with details of the chemical and organic properties of all the elements used.  The program teaches students how to become attentive professionals so as to ensure selection of a right drug for the right treatment for which all topics of pharmacology, chemistry, pharmaceutical chemistry, biochemistry, kinetics, pharmacy management, and compounding medications are covered.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: Who should opt?*  Students who are willing to work around medicines and have a good attitude towards the pharma industry can opt for this course. This course is also ideal for people who wish to open or own a chemist shop and have strong business skills can also opt for B. Pharmacy. With a degree of Bachelor of Pharmacy, a student can register with the State Pharmacy Council and open their own Chemist shop to stock and sell medicines.  The course offers job opportunities in both public as well private sectors that allows students to make a valuable career in this field.Students can even opt for teaching job in this field, if they are willing to become a lecturer. There are different practice environments in this field, some of which are:  *Hospital Pharmacy* *Clinical Pharmacy* *Technical Pharmacy* *Research Agencies* *Medical Dispensing Store* *Food and Drug Administration* *Sales and Marketing Department* *Educational Institutes* *Health Centres*

338 - 20 Dec 2023 04:55PM - Shubham Madhwal: Basically, there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.
339 - 20 Dec 2023 04:55PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 2:* Once the student's complete Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).
340 - 20 Dec 2023 04:55PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 3:* Once the final A-level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.
341 - 20 Dec 2023 04:55PM - Shubham Madhwal: *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
342 - 20 Dec 2023 04:56PM - Shubham Madhwal: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can *complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.*

257 - 20 Dec 2023 12:17PM - Tushti: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.  *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.  *Financial Stability:* By planning early, parents can avoid financial stress and debt. Without proper planning, they may have to rely on loans or other high-cost financing options, which can lead to long-term financial challenges. SAVE YOURSELF FROM LOANS  *INTERNSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK:* Early planning can also involve students participating in projects that will be offered by the EWYL Department of Edoofa after Induction which can help offset the cost of education. These opportunities often have application deadlines, so planning allows parents to take advantage of them.  *Teach Financial Responsibility:* Involving children in the financial planning process can teach them valuable lessons about money management, savings, and responsibility. It helps instill good financial habits from an early age.  *Avoiding Last-Minute Rush:* Delaying financial planning until the last minute can lead to rushed decisions and inadequate savings. Early planning provides a more thoughtful and organized approach.  *Goal Setting:* Setting specific financial goals for education allows parents to track their progress and adjust their savings strategies as needed. It provides a clear roadmap for achieving the desired educational outcomes.  *Peace of Mind:* Knowing that you have a financial plan in place for your child's education can provide peace of mind. It reduces uncertainty and allows parents to focus on other aspects of their child's development without constant worry about funding education.  In conclusion, early financial planning for tertiary education is essential for parents to ensure that they can provide their children with quality education without compromising their own financial stability. It allows for more effective financial management and better opportunities for both parents and students.

205 - 20 Dec 2023 04:46PM - Tushti: So, basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirements as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*
206 - 20 Dec 2023 04:46PM - Tushti: However, as we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

44 - 20 Dec 2023 01:58PM - Tushti: *Bachelor of Arts in Geography* is 3- year an undergraduate course divided into 6 semesters. It involves the study of the earth and its lands, features, inhabitants, and phenomena.  The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. It is one of the specializations of Bachelor of Arts (BA) that deals in various areas such as the study of the features of soil, climate, and plantations are covered in the course besides the geography of the world as a whole.  Students enrolled to the course are taken to annual field trips to observe and analyse field data for stimulating awareness of the environment. They are also trained on cartography and report writing through presentations on thematic atlases and field reports. Upon successful completion of the course, graduates are lucratively hired both in private and public sectors, in colleges, universities, NGOs, among others.  *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. Geography is the study of the earth, including aspects such as land, topography, attributes, people and phenomena. Subjects covered in the discipline are Environment and Ecology, Fundamentals of Remote Sensing and GIS, Statistical Techniques, Spatial Analysis, Advanced Physical Geography, Contemporary Human Geography, Computer Aided Mapping, Thematic Atlas, Spatial Economic Systems, Natural Resource Management, Political Geography, Agricultural Geography, Social Geography of India, Urban Settlement System, Regional Development, Cultural Geography, Hydrology and Water Resource Management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Geography of Landscape, Demography and Population Policy, Health, Environment and Society, among others.  *Who Should Opt?*  Students with the capability of and interest in analysis, problem-solving, decision-making, critically interpreting data and text, developing reasoned arguments, numerical skills, team-work, planning skills, presenting oral and written arguments and information, communication and technology, are best suited for the course.  *Career Prospects*  Successful graduates of the course are professionally recruited as Urban and Regional Planners, Remote Sensing Specialists, Researchers etc.  They are also hired in research agencies meant for environmental issues, population studies and rural development, in the teaching profession at universities, colleges, schools and coaching institutes.  Fieldwork is an essential part of the curriculum, aimed at developing students‚Äô practical skills, hands-on experience, useful in fields like commerce, transport and tourism, business, law and finance sectors.  Successful graduates of the course are hired in fields such as:  *Agriculture Research* *GIS and Remote Sensing* *Colleges and University* *Environment Protection Agencies* *Gas Exploration Companies* *Government Research Institutes* *Mining Industry* *NGOs*   *Agriculture Specialist* Agriculture Specialists often specialize in specific area, for example, animal science, economics, agricultural mechanics, soil science, or field crops. They work closely with farmers and livestock producers to ensure the business‚Äô success  *Geographer* Geographers study the earth and its land, features, and inhabitants. They also examine political or cultural elements related to geography.  *Cartographer* A Cartographer is involved with the scientific, technological and artistic aspects of developing and producing maps. They present complex information as diagrams, charts and spreadsheets, as well as in the form of conventional maps  *Demographer* A demographer, or Demographic Analyst, is a social scientist who uses statistical methods to study the size, distribution and structure of human populations.  *Forest Manager* Forest/ Woodland Managers, or Foresters, are responsible for managing forests and woodlands and overseeing activities such as timber production, conservation and recreation. They maintain and manage various issues associated with woodland areas, such as commercial interests, biodiversity and public access.
